Description of incident: It appears that the Social Security Administration accidentally releases the names, Social Security numbers, and birth dates of thousands of living U.S. citizens each year in a database called the "Death Master File".  Social Security officials revealed that the number of U.S. citizens mistakenly listed each year is about 14,000, while 90 million are accurately reported.  A Scripps Howard News Service review of three recent copies revealed 31,931 living U.S. citizens who'd had their Social Security numbers released to U.S. business groups.
